mapper.update: update t_role set role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, super_admin = #{superAdmin,jdbcType=BIT}, available = #{available,jdbcType=BIT}, create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modify_by = #{modifyBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, modify_time = #{modifyTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, edition = #{edition,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select: select id, role_name, description, super_admin, available, create_by, create_time, modify_by, modify_time, edition from t_role where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
select id, role_name, description, super_admin, available, create_by, create_time, modify_by, modify_time, edition from t_role
select id, role_name, description, super_admin, available, create_by, create_time, modify_by, modify_time, edition from t_role where role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select t_role.id, t_role.role_name, t_role.description, t_role.super_admin, t_role.available, t_role.create_by, t_role.create_time, t_role.modify_by, t_role.modify_time, t_role.edition from t_role, t_user, t_user_role WHERE t_user.login_name like #{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and t_user.id = t_user_role.user_id and t_role.id = t_user_role.role_id

#{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
